title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 3 of 8)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using vertical-slice strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: CV Education & Error Handling
buildSequence.summary: Completes CV parsing capabilities by extracting education information including degrees, institutions, and certifications. Implements comprehensive error handling with confidence scoring and user feedback for parsing quality and manual review recommendations.
testableOutcomes: System identifies and extracts degree types (Bachelor's, Master's, PhD) from CV content
System identifies and extracts field of study information from education sections
System identifies and extracts university or school names from CV text
System identifies and extracts graduation dates or study periods accurately
System identifies certifications and professional qualifications separately from formal degrees
System displays warnings when parsing confidence is low for specific sections
System indicates which extracted sections may need manual review based on confidence scores
System provides detailed parsing quality metrics for each extracted data category
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Medium risk due to diverse education formatting across different countries and institutions. Confidence scoring implementation requires careful calibration to avoid false positives/negatives in quality assessment.

buildSequence.title: AI Usage Tracking & Budget Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive AI usage tracking across Ollama and Claude providers with budget management, cost calculation, and automatic provider switching when limits are exceeded. Provides persistent storage of usage data and budget enforcement mechanisms.
testableOutcomes: System logs Ollama usage without cost tracking when processing requests complete
System tracks both usage and cost for Claude requests against monthly budget
Usage data persists across system restarts and displays breakdown by provider
Default monthly budget is set to $10 when no budget configuration exists
System validates positive numbers when user sets new monthly budget limit
Budget resets to configured amount and usage counter resets when new month begins
System displays warning when Claude usage reaches 75% of monthly budget
System displays urgent warning when Claude usage reaches 90% of monthly budget
System automatically routes requests to Ollama when Claude budget is exceeded
System prevents Claude selection and shows budget exceeded message in Ollama-only mode
Claude becomes available again automatically when new month begins and budget resets
System calculates Claude costs using current pricing rates from token counts
Both input and output tokens are priced according to their respective rates
Running total is updated atomically to prevent race conditions during cost calculation
No cost is added to monthly total when API requests fail or timeout

deliverables: Database migration for usage tracking tables
Comprehensive test suite for all budget scenarios

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical to implement atomic operations for cost tracking to prevent race conditions. Budget enforcement must be fail-safe to prevent overspending. Provider switching logic must be seamless to maintain user experience.

buildSequence.title: AI Usage Dashboard & Cost Calculation
buildSequence.summary: Creates a comprehensive dashboard for viewing AI usage patterns, cost breakdowns, and budget health indicators. Provides historical data comparison and visual indicators for budget status with daily usage breakdowns.
testableOutcomes: Dashboard displays total Claude cost, remaining budget, and request counts for both providers
Dashboard shows daily breakdown of requests and costs for current month
Dashboard compares current month usage to previous months with historical data
Visual indicators show budget health with green for safe, yellow for warning, red for exceeded
Dashboard updates in real-time when new AI requests are processed
Historical data is accessible for at least 12 months of previous usage
Cost calculations match exactly with budget tracking system values
Dashboard loads within 2 seconds even with extensive historical data
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Dashboard must handle large datasets efficiently. Consider implementing data aggregation for historical views. Visual indicators should be intuitive and accessible for all users.

buildSequence.title: User Profile Creation & Preferences
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive user profile creation with job search preferences including target countries, preferred technologies, salary expectations, experience level, and remote work preferences. Provides validation, persistence, and integration with job matching algorithms.
testableOutcomes: Profile setup page displays form fields for target countries, preferred technologies, salary expectations, experience level, and remote preference
Valid profile data submission saves preferences and displays confirmation message
Incomplete required fields trigger validation errors highlighting missing information
Previously entered preferences persist and display when navigating away and returning
Country selection shows searchable list with common job markets prominently displayed
Multiple country selections are displayed and can be individually removed
Invalid country selections trigger error messages with supported alternatives
Job matching algorithm includes only jobs from selected countries in recommendations
Technology field provides autocomplete suggestions for programming languages, frameworks, and tools
Multiple technologies display as removable tags with clear labels
System validates that at least one technology is selected when saving profile
Jobs requiring selected technologies are prioritized in matching results
Custom technology input is accepted and saved when not in predefined list
Salary form displays separate inputs for minimum salary, maximum salary, and currency selection
Non-numeric salary values trigger validation errors prompting for valid numbers
Minimum salary exceeding maximum triggers validation error to correct the range
Currency selection automatically formats salary inputs according to currency conventions
Job matching recommends only positions within or above specified salary range

deliverables: Database migration for user profiles and preferences
Profile creation and validation test suite

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Form validation must be comprehensive and user-friendly. Technology autocomplete should be performant with large datasets. Currency formatting must handle international variations correctly. Profile data structure should be extensible for future enhancements.

buildSequence.title: Profile Experience & Remote Preferences
buildSequence.summary: Implements experience level selection and remote work preference configuration in user profiles. Enables users to specify their career stage and work arrangement preferences for better job matching.
testableOutcomes: User can select from clearly defined experience levels: Junior (0-2 years), Mid-level (2-5 years), Senior (5-8 years), Lead (8+ years)
User can select single experience level with others automatically deselected
System validates and requires experience level selection before profile save
User can select from remote work options: Remote Only, Hybrid, On-site, and No Preference
System hides location fields and shows timezone preferences when Remote Only is selected
User can specify office days or remote percentage when Hybrid is selected
Profile edit page pre-populates all existing preferences in form fields
System updates only modified fields while preserving unchanged preferences
User receives confirmation prompt when navigating away with unsaved changes
Profile completion percentage displays based on filled required and optional fields
System shows specific suggestions for missing profile information
Profile completion percentage updates in real-time as information is added

deliverables: Database migration for experience and remote preferences

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Build on existing profile infrastructure from FBS-024. Focus on form validation, real-time completion tracking, and seamless user experience for preference updates.

buildSequence.title: Job Filtering System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive job filtering capabilities including country, technology, salary range, remote work, and experience level filters. Provides multi-dimensional search with AND/OR logic and real-time result updates.
testableOutcomes: User can select multiple countries and see jobs from any selected country (OR logic)
System displays only jobs located in selected countries when filters are applied
System displays all jobs when no countries are selected
User can select multiple technologies and see jobs requiring at least one selected technology
System applies OR logic for user technology selections while requiring job match ≥1
User can set minimum salary value and see only jobs with salaries ≥ minimum
User can set maximum salary value and see only jobs with salaries ≤ maximum
System validates that minimum salary is not higher than maximum salary
System includes jobs with salary ranges that overlap with filter range
User can enable remote-only toggle and see only remote positions
System displays all work arrangements when remote-only toggle is disabled
User can select multiple experience levels and see jobs matching any selected level
System applies AND logic between different filter types (country AND technology AND salary)
System updates job results when any filter is modified
System displays 'no jobs match your criteria' when multiple filters result in no matches
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex filtering logic requires careful handling of AND/OR combinations, salary range overlaps, and performance optimization for large job datasets. Implement efficient database queries with proper indexing.

buildSequence.title: Advanced Filtering & Filter Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements advanced filter management including active filter display, individual filter removal, clear all functionality, and result count tracking. Provides comprehensive filter state management and user experience enhancements.
testableOutcomes: System displays all active filters in a clear filter summary area
User can click remove option for specific filter and see results update accordingly
User can use 'clear all filters' option to remove all filters and display all jobs
System shows 'no active filters' message when no filters are applied
System displays number of matching jobs alongside active filters in summary
Filter summary area is hidden or shows appropriate message when no filters are active
Individual filter removal updates results without affecting other active filters
Filter state persists correctly across page interactions and updates
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on state management complexity and ensuring filter state consistency across components. Implement efficient result counting without impacting search performance.

buildSequence.title: Application Status Tracking
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive application status management with valid state transitions, timestamp tracking, and status validation. Provides complete lifecycle tracking from initial save through final outcomes.
testableOutcomes: User can view application status with appropriate visual indicators for each state (Saved, Reviewing, Applied, Interviewing, Rejected, Offered)
System enforces valid status transitions: Saved→(Reviewing|Applied|Rejected), Reviewing→(Applied|Interviewing|Rejected), Applied→(Interviewing|Rejected|Offered), Interviewing→(Rejected|Offered)
System prevents invalid backward transitions and displays error messages for rejected changes
User can mark any application as rejected from any current status
System automatically records timestamps for all status changes and displays them in chronological order
System maintains original rejection timestamp when attempting to re-reject an application

deliverables: Database migration for application status tracking

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex state machine with multiple transition rules. Requires careful validation logic and comprehensive error handling for invalid transitions. Status history tracking needs efficient database design.

buildSequence.title: Application Status Validation & Initialization
buildSequence.summary: Ensures all new applications start with proper 'Saved' status and implements validation for status initialization. Provides consistent application creation workflow.
testableOutcomes: System automatically assigns 'Saved' status to all newly created applications
New applications display 'Saved' status when no explicit status is provided
Application creation timestamp matches the initial 'Saved' status timestamp
System validates that all applications have a valid initial status before persistence
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Simple initialization logic that extends FBS-028. Focus on ensuring consistent default behavior and proper integration with status tracking system.

buildSequence.title: Hybrid Match Score Algorithm
buildSequence.summary: Implements sophisticated job-candidate matching algorithm combining TF-IDF text similarity (30%), skill overlap analysis (40%), experience level matching (20%), and semantic embeddings (10%) for accurate job recommendations.
testableOutcomes: System calculates match scores between 0-100% for any user profile and job posting combination
Final match score consists of exactly 30% TF-IDF similarity, 40% skill overlap, 20% experience match, and 10% semantic embeddings
TF-IDF component filters stop words and returns high similarity (>80%) for identical keywords, near 0% for no common terms
Skill overlap component returns 100% for complete matches, proportional scores for partial matches, and recognizes equivalent skill variations (JavaScript/JS)
Experience match component returns 100% for exact matches, >90% for slight overqualification, proportional scores for underqualification, and applies penalties for significant overqualification
System handles missing profile data gracefully and returns consistent scores (±0.1%) for identical inputs
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex algorithm requiring careful weight balancing and performance optimization. TF-IDF implementation needs efficient text processing. Skill matching requires comprehensive normalization. Experience matching needs nuanced overqualification penalties. Integration with AI service for semantic embeddings adds complexity.
